questions.question_text: Which three protocols could an NSX administrator use to transfer log messages to a remote log server? (Choose three.)
Which CLI command would an administrator use to allow syslog on an ESXi transport node when using the esxcli utility?

choices.C: esxcli network firewall ruleset set -a -e false
choices.D: esxcli network firewall ruleset set -r syslog -e false
choices.A: esxcli network firewall ruleset set -r syslog -e true

discussion.content:
A: esxcli network firewall ruleset set --ruleset-id=syslog --enabled=true
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2003322

Selected Answer: AE
Not sure but believe that is A and E

Here are the steps to configure Network Introspection on the host pNIC:

Go to Networking > Hosts & Clusters.
Select the host that you want to configure Network Introspection on.
Click Edit.
Go to the Network Interfaces tab.
Select the pNIC that you want to configure Network Introspection on.
Click Edit.
Go to the Security tab.
Under Network Introspection, select the Enable checkbox.
Click Save.


Here are the steps to configure Network Introspection on the Edge Node:

Go to Networking > Tier-0 Gateways.
Select the Edge Node that you want to configure Network Introspection on.
Click Edit.
Go to the Services tab.
Under Network Introspection, click Configure.
Select the Enable checkbox.
Click Save.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is configuring service insertion for Network Introspection.

Which two places can the Network Introspection be configured? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Syslog is not configured on the ESXi transport node.
choices.C: Syslog is not configured on the NSX Manager.
choices.A: Zero Trust Security is not enabled.
choices.B: Distributed Firewall Rule logging is not enabled.

questions.question_text:
An NSX administrator is reviewing syslog and notices that Distributed Firewall Rules hit counts are not being logged.

What could cause this issue?

choices.A: VMware Identity Manager with NSX added as a Web Application
choices.C: VMware Identity Manager with an OAuth Client added
choices.B: Active Directory LDAP integration with OAuth Client added
choices.D: Active Directory LDAP integration with ADFS

questions.question_text:
As part of an organization's IT security compliance requirement, NSX Manager must be configured for 2FA (two-factor authentication).

What should an NSX administrator have ready before the integration can be configured?

discussion.content:
Answer: C
VMware Identity Manager is an identity as a service (IDaaS) solution.
VMware Identity Manager provides the following services for software as a service (SaaS), web, cloud, and native mobile applications:
Application provisioning
Conditional access controls
Single sign-on (SSO)
VMware products can use VMware Identity Manager as an enterprise SSO solution.
VMware Identity Manager is based on the OAuth 2.0 authorization framework.

Selected Answer: C
I think the answer is C

Selected Answer: C
I believe is C, but could not confirm
